description:
Based on inorganic solid-state chemistry, we engage in Materials Informatics (MI) that integrates experiments, calculations, and data science.
Through the Starrydata project, which I planned and led, we collected and structured over 200,000 curves of materials property data from graph images in published papers to build a large-scale database.
Starrydata is utilized in cutting-edge research as the world's largest experimental database of thermoelectric materials.
In the future, we aim to become the foundation for experimental MI research worldwide as a massive database that digitizes experimental data across all of materials science.
